meanings.definition: Sinhs (noun): plural form of sinh, a traditional garment worn in Laos and Thailand
meanings.sent1: In Laos, many people wear sinhs during special celebrations.
meanings.sent2: The colorful sinhs are a symbol of cultural pride in Thailand.
meanings.sent3: At the festival, everyone showed off their beautiful sinhs.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of sinhs was a rainbow of vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the sinhs were mesmerizing to behold.

meanings.definition: Sinhs (verb): third person singular present of sinh, to wear a traditional garment in Laos and Thailand
meanings.sent1: She always sinhs her favorite sinh when visiting her grandparents.
meanings.sent2: He sinhs the elegant sinh with grace and elegance.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to sinhs the tiny sinh as a makeshift cape.
meanings.sent4: The dancer sinhs the flowing sinh like a graceful swan.
meanings.sent5: In the play, the actor will sinhs the royal sinh for the coronation scene.
